author: bridge-bot
content:
<nicoserranop> Sequencer devs: I am getting the error `called Option::unwrap() on a None value` when trying to get the id_token for the receipt in the `/contribute` route. 

If anyone is free, could we have a video call to check it? I'm a bit stuck :(

author: kevaundray
content: I am guessing you are running a sequencer locally?

author: kevaundray
content:
Can you open an issue on the sequencer repo with the changes you made locally (if any) and what commit you are branching from?

If you are working locally, I'm also guessing that you created your own oAuth credentials that redirect to your localhost

author: bridge-bot
content: <Marcin> Ooof, I think I see how this would happen. I'll fix it tomorrow, but for now I think I can offer you a hack: try running with `--lobby-checkin-tolerance=200`, this should let you progress

author: bridge-bot
content:
<nicoserranop> > <nicoserranop>  Thank you Marcin! It worked with lobby-checkin-tolerance=20 but with 200 it gives me the screenshot error. I will keep it in 20 for the moment :)

I submitted an issue here: https://github.com/ethereum/kzg-ceremony-sequencer/issues/75 (re @Marcin: Ooof, I think I see how this would happen. I'll fix it tomorrow, but for now I think I can offer you a hack: try running with --lobby-checkin-tolerance=200, this should let you progress)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<Marcin> > <Marcin>  Yeah, sorry, my bad. I'll give you an algorithm instead of a value pulled out of nowhere. Set `--lobby-checkin-tolerance` and `--lobby-checkin-frequency` such that their sum is greater than the time it takes to actually compute a contribution and that frequency >= tolerance :) Anyway, I'll have a PR fixing this tomorrow morning (CEST). (re @nicoserranop: Thank you Marcin! It worked with lobby-checkin-tolerance=20 but with 200 it gives me the screenshot error. I will keep it in 20 for the moment :)

I submitted an issue here: https://github.com/ethereum/kzg-ceremony-sequencer/issues/75)
